newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-KPN funds TNT bid by credit facility.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-KPN funds TNT bid by credit facility.

text.p: Dutch post and telecoms group Koninklijke PTT Nederland NV said on Wednesday it would fund its A$2.0 billion bid for Australian transport group TNT Ltd from working capital and a 2.25 billion guilder (A$1.7 billion) revolving credit facility arranged and underwritten by Goldman Sachs.
Earlier on Wednesday, KPN said it would bid A$2.45 per share for TNT, valuing the group at A$2 billion, a 48 percent premium to its current market capitalisation.

"KPN is financing the offer and providing working capital facilities for the combined group by means of existing cash resources and a 2.25 billion guilder (A$1.7 billion) revolving credit facility, which has been arranged and fully underwritten by Goldman Sachs," KPN said in a joint statement with TNT announcing the bid.
TNT said it recommended shareholders accept the offer.
